group_1.textLeft: No, I would rather thank you for taking the time.

group_1.textRight: But, Papa, why are we talking in the courtyard?

group_1.textLeft: From now on, I will be speaking to you as@Touka's father and Nayuta's uncle.
I like to change my environment when I'm@talking about things that aren't about work.
So, I gave Nayuta homework,@and I also gave it to Touka,
but have you two prepared answers for it?
And what is your answer?

group_1.textRight: Losing a loved one is something I can't do anything about.
It's only natural that all living creatures die,@turn to dust, and change with the earth.
Even if a great number of people die due to a@change in our environment,
it's still a process that allows humankind to evolve@and become stronger creatures.

group_1.textLeft: In the process of adapting to the environment and evolving, deaths leave behind a lot of information@to sort through.
That's why it's as important as it is inevitable.

group_1.textRight: Besides, our souls are out of our reach...
since they're being rolled around in the palm of God's hand, there's nothing we can do at the moment.
So until we can see a glimmer of hope, I can only say that it's something I can't do anything about.

group_1.textLeft: No matter what we do, we can't grab hold of@the reins on human life...
I suppose it means that becoming separated is inevitable since we can't change it.
Alright...
Nayuta, what are your thoughts?

group_1.textRight: At first I...thought it was hope...
but now I just simply think it is sad and painful.
Even after thinking deeply upon it,@I cannot betray my feelings.

group_1.textLeft: It really is simple, huh.
No, I'm the one who pushed you for something that doesn't have a right or wrong answer.
Though, I am glad I got you to think.
I'll contact your mother.
You understand how you felt back then, but you@need to understand how your mother feels now.
Your mother is a selfish person that broke up with Tasuke without thinking of the consequences,
but even when she was still thinking of you,@yet she still left.
Now she seems like she's worried about you@and is searching for your father.
If she met you, Nayuta, and all you talked about@was your father,
she would be so shocked and wouldn't know@what to do.
You may feel like blaming yourself@after thinking about it so much,
but it's her problem,@so don't beat yourself up over it, Nayuta.

group_1.textRight: Huh?@Papa, why was I given the homework?

group_1.textLeft: Because it seems Touka has been up to some bad things lately.
I can feel it in the air that you're at the center@of something.
Just listen to me for a second.
Touka's eyes are aimed too high.
It's better to sit high, even just in the middle,
where everyone and the city are out of sight,@and you can only see a few houses.
You can't think on the scale of all of humanity,@but you can think of your own surroundings@and the individuals that fill it.
Don't forget that...
(For the time being, I think I can speak with Mama...)
Huh? Touka and Nayuta!?
Meoowhaat? It's the double Amanes?
Shut it nyaa, I'm trying to thiiink!
You flute sisters should just be silent!
We were just having a small conversation with@Touka's father.

group_1.textCenter: So that is why she told me to be quiet.

group_1.textRight: Nayuta, are you continuing your search@for your father from the other day?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, in three days,@I will be able to connect with my mother.
Thank you.[chara:103701:lipSynch_0][wait:1.0][chara:103701:cheek_0][chara:103701:face_mtn_ex_010.exp.json:motion_0][chara:103701:lipSynch_1]@What were you two doing here?

group_1.textCenter: We have been helping Mifuyu@prepare Alina for her discharge from the hospital,

group_1.textRight: We need to hurry up and find her, Tsukuyo!

group_1.textCenter: Then, if you would please excuse us!

group_1.textLeft: I'm not the only one having a hard time.
